items.text: After hanging out with friends all day, you feel full of energy.
You would rather have a quiet weekend at home than go to a big party.
When you have a problem, talking about it with a friend helps you understand it better.
In a group, you are usually one of the first people to speak up.
After being with people for a long time, you need some alone time to rest.
You prefer talking to one or two friends for a long time rather than talking to lots of people for just a minute.
When you are bored, you usually look for someone to play with or talk to.
You like to think about your ideas by yourself before telling anyone else.
You usually enjoy meeting new people, even if you don't have to.
After being alone for a while, you really want to go find someone to talk to.
You are good at noticing small details that other people might not see.
When learning something new, you like seeing real examples rather than just hearing about the idea.
You like doing things the way they have always been done instead of trying a brand new way.
You like it when people tell you exactly what they mean instead of being vague.
You think more about what is happening right now than what might happen in the future.
When you see something happen, you can think of many different reasons why it might have happened.
You enjoy stories that have hidden meanings or symbols.
You like to see how different things fit together to make a bigger story.
You care more about why something works than just remembering facts about it.
You often think about what might happen in the future and what things could turn into.
When making a choice, you look at the facts rather than how you feel about it.
When you disagree with someone, you care more about being right than about keeping everyone happy.
You want people to tell you exactly what they think, even if it's a bit mean.
You care more if an idea makes sense than if it makes people upset.
When you argue with someone, you can stay mad at the problem without being mad at the person.
When you make a choice, you think a lot about how it will make other people feel.
You usually do what feels right in your heart rather than what seems logical.
You try to be very careful with your words so you don't hurt anyone's feelings.
If you have two good choices, you pick the one that keeps your friends happy.
You are more likely to believe a story about a real person than a bunch of numbers.
You like to have a plan before you start doing something.
You feel better once you have made a choice and don't have to think about it anymore.
You like having a schedule and knowing exactly when things need to be finished.
You like to finish making plans early instead of waiting until the last minute.
You like your day to be planned out instead of just doing whatever you feel like.
You don't mind if plans change suddenly.
You like to wait as long as possible before making a final choice.
You like to try a few different ways of doing something before picking the best one.
You like to leave extra time in your plans in case something new happens.
If something changes, you are happy to change your plans instead of sticking to the old ones.
